getInstanceForApplication

public static ProximityKitManager getInstanceForApplication(android.content.Context context)
An accessor for the singleton instance of this class. A context must be provided, but if you need to use it from a non-Activity or non-Service class, you can attach it to another singleton or a subclass of the Android Application class.

getIBeaconManager

public IBeaconManager getIBeaconManager()
Convenience method to access the iBeacon manager

Returns:

start

public void start()
Syncs data from ProximityKit, and once the sync is done, starts looking for iBeacons matching the beacon regions set up in ProximityKit, pre-enabling monitoring, ranging, and data callbacks to the ProximityKitNotifier

restart

public void restart()
This method is used to reconfigure the ProximityKit properties at runtime There is no need to call this method if you are configurng ProximityKit from a .properties file.

restart

public void restart(java.lang.String code)

sync

public void sync()

setNotifier

public void setNotifier(ProximityKitNotifier notifier)
Sets the object that will receive all ProximityKit callbacks. IMPORTANT NOTE: If you set this notifier, you should not manually set any notifiers on the IBeaconManager instance for your application. Doing so will stop ProximityKit's ability to work with iBeacons.

Parameters:
notifier -

getNotifier

public ProximityKitNotifier getNotifier()
Returns the instance to the object receiving ProximityKit notifications.

Returns:

getKit

public Kit getKit()
The local copy of the kit you have set up on ProximityKit.com

Returns:

setKit

public void setKit(Kit kit)
Used by the system when sync'ing data form the server. Should not be called by end users.

Parameters:
kit -
